column4: ok so now the hardware is actually showing up in eth1 as it should.  But I get "Ignoring unknown interface" when I try to /etc/init.d/networking restart  -  if I use ifconfig to set an IP it works just fine. wth?
-> which interface are you having issues with?
-> you have a static ip address assigned to it, is that what you desired?
-> so what not working? you have an ip address assigned..
it doesn't automatically assign itself an IP, I have to set it with ifconfig
-> after you did a /etc/init.d/networking restart  your eth1 did not get an ip address?
that's what i'm trying to tell you, yes.  it errors and says ignoring unknown device
-> your interfaces are missing entries for gateway, mask, etc.. please man interfaces   to get a sypnosis
... I don't need a gateway, this IS the gateway
-> umm lets back up a few, can you tell us what is your network layout?  what devices are connected to which?
it was a type in my /etc/network/interfaces file.  I had eht1 instead of eth1  :X
yep, it works.  I did however have to take the gateway assignment out of the equation, kinda messed up my iptables.  but yes it works now
-> good, another pair of eyes usually points out those little details :P
